p: Controlling postharvest diseases by ethanol application has been tested by various previous reports; e.g., Botrytis cinerea was controlled in table grape [ 60] and anthracnose in loquat fruit [ 18]. The reduced fungal growth in samples treated by ethanol is due to its striking lethal interactions with fungal spore that occurred in the mitochondrial membrane [ 61]. In this study and previous study on rocket [ 62], AsA treatment reduced MY and total microbial count. Regarding AsA application, it reduces the pH; a lower pH value is unsuitable for microbial growth [ 35].
